normalised: Rental Agreements Getting a Refresh: Are You Ready?

unnormalised: **Rental Agreements Getting a Refresh: Are You Ready?**
normalised: Hey folks! Renting in Mumbai just got a tad more interesting. Turns out, rental agreements are seeing some changes, so listen up!

unnormalised: Hey folks! Renting in Mumbai just got a tad more interesting. Turns out, rental agreements are seeing some changes, so listen up!
normalised: Word on the street is, landlords like Doctor Sharma from Andheri are streamlining agreements. Think clearer clauses and less legal jargon – finally! A recent survey by the Indian Real Estate Council suggests most landlords want easier templates.

unnormalised: Word on the street is, landlords like Dr. Sharma from Andheri are streamlining agreements. Think clearer clauses and less legal jargon – finally! A recent survey by the Indian Real Estate Council suggests most landlords want easier templates.
normalised: One big change? Many are now including clauses about pet ownership – good news for all the dog lovers out there! Also, expect more emphasis on maintenance responsibilities. No more blaming the poor tenant for leaky taps, right?

unnormalised: One big change? Many are now including clauses about pet ownership – good news for all the dog lovers out there! Also, expect more emphasis on maintenance responsibilities. No more blaming the poor tenant for leaky taps, right?
normalised: Plus, security deposits are becoming more standardized, often capped at two to three months rent. Thank heavens! Talking of rent, with property prices soaring, some are suggesting yearly increases tied to the inflation rate, maybe capped at rupee five thousand.

unnormalised: Plus, security deposits are becoming more standardized, often capped at 2-3 months' rent. Thank heavens! Talking of rent, with property prices soaring, some are suggesting yearly increases tied to the inflation rate, maybe capped at Rs. 5,000.
normalised: Keep an eye out for clauses on notice periods too. Many are pushing for sixty days at least. So, if you’re planning to move to that swanky one thousand square foot apartment in Bandra, do your homework first. Makes sense, eh?

unnormalised: Keep an eye out for clauses on notice periods too. Many are pushing for 60 days at least. So, if you’re planning to move to that swanky 1,000 sq ft apartment in Bandra, do your homework first. Makes sense, eh?
normalised: Remember to get your agreements registered to avoid future hassles. Happy renting, ya!

unnormalised: Remember to get your agreements registered to avoid future hassles. Happy renting, ya!
